intro: Selaginella bakeriana, commonly known as the Baker's spikemoss, is a species of spikemoss belonging to the family Selaginellaceae. It is a low-growing, evergreen plant that typically forms dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. The plant has slender, branching stems covered in small, scale-like leaves that are usually green to reddish in color. Its reproductive structures, called strobila, are cone-like and produce spores for propagation. Selaginella bakeriana is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
